design_audit.strata_or_blocks: Stratified RCT: quota-based sampling on age, sex, region, education, town size, employment status
design_audit.instrument: traite_cible (random assignment of income threshold for dividend eligibility) interacted with traite_cible_conjoint
design_audit.endogenous_var: gagnant_cible_categorie!='Perdant' (believes does not lose from targeted dividend)
design_audit.n_obs_subsample: percentile_revenu in [10,60] (respondents near income threshold where instrument bites)
design_audit.notes: 2SLS implemented manually: first-stage LPM predicts non_perdant from random treatment, second-stage LPM regresses acceptance on predicted beliefs. ivreg also run for F-statistics but does not support survey weights.

claim_object.outcome_concept: Carbon tax acceptance: taxe_cible_approbation!='Non' (not opposed to targeted tax+dividend policy)
claim_object.treatment_concept: Self-interest belief: believing one does not lose from the carbon tax+dividend (gagnant_cible_categorie!='Perdant')
claim_object.estimand_concept: LATE/IV: causal effect of self-interest beliefs on carbon tax acceptance, using random eligibility to dividend as instrument for beliefs
claim_object.target_population: French adult respondents in representative online survey (stratified RCT)

baseline_specs.label: Table5.2-Col1-IV-p10p60
baseline_specs.description: 2SLS (manual): acceptance ~ non_perdant + controls, where non_perdant instrumented by traite_cible*traite_cible_conjoint. Sub-sample: percentile_revenu in [10,60]. Survey weights.
controls: variables_reg_self_interest (prog_na, Simule_gain, Simule_gain2, taxe_efficace, single, hausse_depenses_par_uc, demographics, piecewise income percentiles)
baseline_specs.notes: Main identification: sub-sample near income threshold where random assignment of dividend eligibility shifts beliefs. 53 p.p. effect. variables_reg_self_interest = 6 named (prog_na, Simule_gain, Simule_gain2, taxe_efficace, single, hausse_depenses_par_uc) + 17 from variables_demo (21 minus revenu/rev_tot/age/age_65_plus) + 6 piecewise income spline terms + 3 second-stage extras (cible, I(taxe_approbation=='NSP'), tax_acceptance).

baseline_specs.label: Table5.2-Col2-IV-fullsample
baseline_specs.description: 2SLS on full sample (no income restriction). Same controls and instruments.
baseline_specs.notes: 46 p.p. effect. Full-sample version adds extra 'single' control in second stage. Same variables_reg_self_interest + cible + I(taxe_approbation=='NSP') + tax_acceptance + single.

constraints.notes: Bundled IV estimator: the same control set appears in both first and second stage. The instrument set (traite_cible, traite_cible_conjoint, interaction) is structurally determined by the experimental design and cannot be varied. The control set includes piecewise-linear income (knots at p20, p70), 17 demographics, estimated gains (Simule_gain quadratic), tax efficacy belief, and several other covariates (~29-33 total). Controls should vary jointly across stages. Manual 2SLS SEs do not correct for generated-regressor uncertainty.

explore_universe.description: Table 5.2 Col 3: simple OLS with non_perdant as explanatory variable (no IV). Changes identification from LATE to OLS association, fundamentally different estimand.

Table 5.2 Col 4: feedback sub-experiment (variante_taxe_info=='f', |simule_gain|<50) with simule_gagnant as instrument. Uses different sub-experiment, different instrument set, and different outcome (taxe_feedback_approbation).

canonical.notes: Paper uses default OLS standard errors from lm() in R (classical, not HC). Manual 2SLS means SEs do not account for generated-regressor uncertainty. Survey weights applied via weights argument.

variants.notes: HC1 robust SEs as a stress test on heteroskedasticity.

sampling.notes: Control set is large (~20 variables). LOO by conceptual blocks (income, demographics, estimated gains, political, tax-related) is feasible. Subset sampling within blocks may be needed for full combinatorial exploration.

diagnostics_plan.notes: Appendix A: t-tests for representativeness on sex, age, CSP, education, town size, region.
First-stage F-statistics reported for each IV specification. Effective F-stats from ivreg diagnostics.

design_audit.strata_or_blocks: Stratified RCT: information treatments randomly assigned
design_audit.instrument: apres_modifs (info on environmental effectiveness) + info_CC (info on climate change)
design_audit.endogenous_var: taxe_efficace=='Oui' (believes carbon tax is environmentally effective)
design_audit.notes: Instruments are randomly assigned information treatments about environmental effectiveness of carbon taxation and climate change. Sargan overid test does not reject (p=0.93).

claim_object.outcome_concept: Carbon tax approval: taxe_approbation=='Oui' (approves initial tax+dividend policy)
claim_object.treatment_concept: Belief in environmental effectiveness of carbon tax (taxe_efficace=='Oui')
claim_object.estimand_concept: LATE/IV: causal effect of environmental effectiveness belief on tax approval, using random information treatment as instrument
claim_object.target_population: French adult respondents in representative online survey

baseline_specs.label: Table5.4-Col1-IV-YesYes
baseline_specs.description: 2SLS: approval(Yes) ~ effectiveness(Yes), instrumented by info_EE + info_CC. Full controls.
controls: variables_reg_ee (Revenu, Revenu2, Revenu_conjoint, Revenu_conjoint2, single, Simule_gain, Simule_gain2, gagnant_categorie, 17 demographic vars from variables_demo minus revenu/rev_tot/age/age_65_plus)
baseline_specs.notes: 42 p.p. effect. Instruments: apres_modifs + info_CC. variables_reg_ee = 8 named + 17 demographics.

baseline_specs.label: Table5.4-Col3-IV-NotNoYes
baseline_specs.description: 2SLS: acceptance(not No) ~ effectiveness(Yes), same instruments and controls.
baseline_specs.notes: 50 p.p. effect. Same first stage as Col 1. Same control set as Col 1.

constraints.notes: Bundled IV: same control set in first and second stage. Instrument set (apres_modifs + info_CC) is experimentally determined and fixed. The control set variables_reg_ee = 8 named vars + 17 demographics = ~25 total. Controls should vary jointly across stages.

explore_universe.description: Table 5.4 Col 2: OLS with taxe_efficace as explanatory variable (no IV). Changes identification from LATE to OLS association.

Appendix A4: endogenous variable is taxe_efficace!='Non' instead of taxe_efficace=='Oui'. Changes the belief being instrumented (not disbelieving vs actively believing), which is a different claim object.

canonical.notes: Default OLS SEs from lm() in R (classical, not HC). Manual 2SLS means SEs do not account for generated-regressor uncertainty. Survey weights applied.

sampling.notes: Control set is moderately large (~15 variables). LOO by conceptual blocks is feasible.

diagnostics_plan.notes: Effective F-statistics from ivreg. Table D.5 shows first-stage reduced-form effects of information treatments on beliefs.
Sargan test for overidentification (2 instruments, 1 endogenous). Paper reports p=0.93.
